head.title: Bronx Man Arrested In Cabdriver's Killing

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: Bronx Man Arrested In Cabdriver's Killing

abstract.p: Bronx detectives arrest Victor J Disla, charged with killing cab driver Baurihima Doukoure; incident stemmed from argument over a parking space (S)

block.p: Detectives have arrested a Bronx man and charged him with killing a taxi driver during an argument over a parking space last Saturday, the police said.

The suspect, Victor J. Disla, 24, of 731 Gerard Avenue, was charged with second-degree murder in the killing near a gas station at 59th Street and 11th Avenue in Manhattan, said Sgt. Andrew McInnis, a police spokesman.
Detectives have arrested a Bronx man and charged him with killing a taxi driver during an argument over a parking space last Saturday, the police said.

The suspect, Victor J. Disla, 24, of 731 Gerard Avenue, was charged with second-degree murder in the killing near a gas station at 59th Street and 11th Avenue in Manhattan, said Sgt. Andrew McInnis, a police spokesman.

The driver of the yellow cab, Baurahima Doukoure, 37, was stabbed in the chest around 11 p.m. and died at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center two hours later, the police said. The knife used was not recovered.
